channel.title: Ruby
channel.description:
long story short I'm trying to learn Ruby so I can use ruby scripts as plugins for a java application, so I ask you this:
What are the first steps I should take before attempting to tackle Ruby? How did you learn Ruby? Is there anything I need before I can start scripting in Ruby (like jdk for java)? Any good online tutorials, ebooks, etc. you recommend I should read?
thanks in advance

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:31, topic:538552”]so far i like the simplicity of the syntax, but it just seems really odd to me

will take some getting used to[/quote]It’s really not that bad. It is an incredibly powerful language, especially when you can do:
http://vimeo.com/61087285

item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:29, topic:538552”]Wow can’t wait to use Go for my Android apps, much impressed

http://www.businessinsider.com/googles-go-could-replace-java-2013-8[/quote]
I read that, but didn’t see anything by Google themselves yet?
Go was released in 2009 (silly me for not keeping myself updated). I heard its a pretty slow language though.

They’ll switch eventually lol

.NET is for bigger companies with money while java is for smaller ones that rather not pay microsoft.
It wont change due security flaws or because you read it somewhere on the trustworthy webs.

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:26, topic:538552”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=657383.msg4398110#msg4398110 date=1389734806]

Android is going to stop using Java in the near future.
[/quote]sauce? Google has been using Java for its infrastructure for many years which is why they used Java for android in the first place, so I’m curious if you actually saw that in the news somewhere because I didnt hear they are swapping

I’ve heard and read quiet a few things so the possibilitys could stand. I should have not said it as if they are going to but they might.

I’m pretty sure there’s a lawsuit with Oracle about Dalvik VM? That would be a contributing factor.[/quote]

You mean the court case that has gone no where for Oracle?

Read full topic

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:23, topic:538552”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=657383.msg4398014#msg4398014 date=1389699478]
Because Java sucky balls!
[/quote]
Any evidence for that? I do believe java’s execution and processing is better than a lot of programming languages.[/quote]
Nobody is going to use Java anymore. Businesses specially because of the security flaws etc.

I’m personally heading down C#, Ruby, .NET because you have better control (imo) and that it’s industrly better for you.

Apple use Objective C for their iOS applications and Android is going to stop using Java in the near future.

Read full topic

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:21, topic:538552”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=657383.msg4398007#msg4398007 date=1389694965]
Ruby is easy to learn if you have knowledge on languages such as Python and C.
I would not recommend using Ruby with Java but using Ruby solely for your application (depending on what it is).

The only thing I think you’d struggle with is using gems, but most of them have good documentations.
[/quote]

Why would you not recommend using jRuby? It’s great… The only large downfall could get to the startup time, after that performance is amazing and it’s a resource that’s saved many a programmers arse.[/quote]
Because Java sucky balls!

Read full topic

I would not recommend using Ruby with Java but using Ruby solely for your application (depending on what it is).

The only thing I think you’d struggle with is using gems, but most of them have good documentations.[/quote]

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Ruby is easy to learn if you have knowledge on languages such as Python and C.
I would not recommend using Ruby with Java but using Ruby solely for your application (depending on what it is).

The only thing I think you’d struggle with is using gems, but most of them have good documentations.

Read full topic

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:18, topic:538552”]http://beginningruby.org/

Speaking of books, I’m currently going through this book. It’s a pretty good start so far. I’m skimming the first couple of chapters because they’re all things I’m familiar with, but the projects and examples aren’t looking too bad.

http://ruby.railstutorial.org/

I also bought the printed version of this book. The online version is updated much more, and I have a duplicate page, one of which takes place of a missing page… But I was able to go online and figure out what the missing page was supposed to be. I learned a lot at the end of this book.[/quote]

As for a general introduction to Ruby, I’d also recommend the “Pickaxe” book – it’s quite nice.

Read full topic

http://ruby.railstutorial.org/

I also bought the printed version of this book. The online version is updated much more, and I have a duplicate page, one of which takes place of a missing page… But I was able to go online and figure out what the missing page was supposed to be. I learned a lot at the end of this book.

item.title: Ruby
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:9, topic:538552”][quote author=Docent link=topic=657383.msg4397896#msg4397896 date=1389661887]
I tried it, wasn’t my language. It was too simple for me, It didn’t really feel like I was coding.
[/quote]
Show us the last thing you were attempting in Ruby, please.[/quote]

wasn’t attempting anything… just fooling around.

[code=ruby]class MyClass
def bacon
puts( “Woop Woop” )
end
end

ob = MyClass.new
ob.bacon
[/code]

[code=ruby]def showstring
puts( “Hello”)
end

def showname( aName )
puts( “Whats Up #{aName}?” )
end

def return_name( aFirstName, aSecondName )
return "How are my homies #{aFirstName} and #{aSecondName} doin??"
end

showstring
showname( “Me” )
puts( return_name( “Myself”, “I” ) )[/code]

Read full topic
